13.title: Configuring the Text-to-Speech Tool
13.content: To add pronunciation guides to your flashcards, you need to configure the text-to-speech tool for your target language. Follow these steps: . | Generate your first flashcard as described in the previous step. | In Anki, go to Tools > Manage Note Types. | You should see the flashcard type corresponding to the language of the word or phrase you selected. For example, if you selected an American English term, look for AnkiLingoFlash_English (US) [1 note]. | Select the appropriate card type and click on Cards‚Ä¶. | In the card editor: . | Check the Back Template. | Click on OK to dismiss any message that appears. | Click on Add TTS. | . | Configure the text-to-speech service: . | Select the service you want to use. For example, for English, you can choose the free local service Youdao Dictionary. | Choose the appropriate voice (e.g., English, American [default] for American English). | Click on Save, then on OK. | . | Set up the TTS fields: . | For the Field option, select Selection. | For the Language field, select the desired language for text-to-speech. | . | Finalize the setup: . | Click on Insert into Back Template. | Close the message that appears by clicking on OK. | In the Back Template, find the line [Pronunciation guide not yet installed and/or configured. To install, click here. To configure, click here.] and replace it with the line that was just added (it should contain the TTS tag). For example, if you chose the American English voice with Youdao Dictionary, the line should look like this: {{tts en_US voices=AwesomeTTS:Selection}}. Note that this new line always starts with {{tts. | Click on Save. | . | . Important: You will need to repeat this process for each language you wish to learn. Congratulations! You have now completely finished setting up AnkiLingoFlash. You can now review the first word or phrase you added to Anki, or continue to add other flashcards.

28.title: Installing Anki-Connect
28.content: Anki-Connect is crucial for AnkiLingoFlash to communicate with your Anki application. Here‚Äôs how to install it: . | Open Anki and go to Tools > Add-ons > Get Add-ons‚Ä¶ . | Enter the code 2055492159 and click OK. | A message prompting you to restart Anki should appear; close it by clicking on OK. | Go back to Tools > Add-ons . | Double-click on AnkiConnect in the add-ons list. | Update the configuration as follows: . | First, select all existing text in the configuration window and delete it. | Then, copy the following new configuration and paste it into the now-empty configuration window: | { "apiKey": null, "apiLogPath": null, "ignoreOriginList": [], "webBindAddress": "127.0.0.1", "webBindPort": 8765, "webCorsOriginList": [ "chrome-extension://hicnjnfcmjfnomdfmekhigghmlkmachb", "moz-extension://<your-firefox-extension-UUID>", "http://localhost/*", "https://*/*" ] } . | . | For Firefox users, you need to replace <your-firefox-extension-UUID> with your actual extension UUID. Here‚Äôs how to find it: . | Open Firefox and type about:debugging#/runtime/this-firefox in the address bar. | Find ‚ÄúAnkiLingoFlash‚Äù in the list of temporary extensions. | Copy the ‚ÄúInternal UUID‚Äù displayed for AnkiLingoFlash. | Replace <your-firefox-extension-UUID> in the configuration with this UUID. | . | Click on OK to save the configuration. | Close the Add-ons window. | Restart Anki to ensure all changes take effect. | . Very nice! Now that you‚Äôve installed Anki-Connect, let‚Äôs move on to the next step: Installing AwesomeTTS.
